tool_description: NFT API. OpenSea API is a tool that allows data in the OpenSea NFT marketplace to be accessed and integrated into applications and websites.
name: OpenSea
title: OpenSea

api_list.name: Events
api_list.description: Get a list of events based on before and after timestamps.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of events to return. Must be between 1 and 50. Default: 50

optional_parameters.name: event_type
optional_parameters.description: The type of event to filter by. If not provided, only sales will be returned.

optional_parameters.name: next
optional_parameters.description: The cursor for the next page of results. This is returned from a previous request.

optional_parameters.name: before
optional_parameters.description: Filter to only include events that occurred before the given timestamp. The Unix epoch timstamp must be in seconds.

optional_parameters.name: after
optional_parameters.description: Filter to only include events that occurred at or after the given timestamp. The Unix epoch timstamp must be in seconds

api_list.name: v1 / Collections
api_list.description:
The `/collections/` endpoint provides a list of all the collections supported and vetted by OpenSea. To include all collections relevant to a user (including non-whitelisted ones), set the` owner` param.

Each collection in the returned area has an attribute called `primary_asset_contracts` with info about the smart contracts belonging to that collection. For example, ERC-1155 contracts maybe have multiple collections all referencing the same contract, but many ERC-721 contracts may all belong to the same collection (dapp).

You can also use this endpoint to find which dapps an account uses, and how many items they own in each - all in one API call!

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: For pagination. Number of contracts offset from the beginning of the result list.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: For pagination. Maximum number of contracts to return.

optional_parameters.name: asset_owner
optional_parameters.description: A wallet address. If specified, will return collections where the owner owns at least one asset belonging to smart contracts in the collection. The number of assets the account owns is shown as `owned_asset_count` for each collection.

api_list.name: Collections
api_list.description: Get a list of OpenSea collections.

optional_parameters.name: chain
optional_parameters.description: The blockchain on which to filter the results.

optional_parameters.name: next
optional_parameters.description: The cursor for the next page of results. This is returned from a previous request.

optional_parameters.name: include_hidden
optional_parameters.description: If true, will return hidden collections. Default: false

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of collections to return. Must be between 1 and 100. Default: 100

optional_parameters.name: creator_username
optional_parameters.description: If set, will only return collections created by the given OpenSea username.

api_list.name: Contract
api_list.description: Get a smart contract for a given chain and address.

required_parameters.name: chain
required_parameters.description: The blockchain on which to filter the results

api_list.name: Account
api_list.description: Get an OpenSea Account Profile including details such as bio, social media usernames, and profile image.

api_list.name: v1 / Collection Stats
api_list.description: Use this endpoint to fetch stats for a specific collection, including realtime floor price statistics.

api_list.name: Collection Stats
api_list.description: Get stats for a single collection.

required_parameters.name: collection_slug
required_parameters.description: Unique string to identify a collection on OpenSea. This can be found by visiting the collection on the OpenSea website and noting the last path parameter.

api_list.name: Single Contract
api_list.description: Used to fetch more in-depth information about an contract asset.

api_list.name: Assets
api_list.description: To retrieve assets from our API, call the `/assets/` endpoint with the desired filter parameters.

optional_parameters.name: asset_contract_addresses
optional_parameters.description: An array of contract addresses to search for (e.g. `?asset_contract_addresses=0x1...&asset_contract_addresses=0x2...`). Will return a list of assets with contracts matching any of the addresses in this array. If **token_ids** is also specified, then it will only return assets that match each `(address, token_id)` pairing, respecting order.

optional_parameters.name: order_direction
optional_parameters.description: Can be `asc` for ascending or `desc` for descending

optional_parameters.name: include_orders
optional_parameters.description: A flag determining if order information should be included in the response.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit. Defaults to 20, capped at 50.

optional_parameters.name: collection_slug
optional_parameters.description: Limit responses to members of a collection. Case sensitive and must match the collection slug exactly. Will return all assets from all contracts in a collection.

optional_parameters.name: cursor
optional_parameters.description: A cursor pointing to the page to retrieve

optional_parameters.name: asset_contract_address
optional_parameters.description: The NFT contract address for the assets

optional_parameters.name: collection
optional_parameters.description: Limit responses to members of a collection. Case sensitive and must match the collection slug exactly. Will return all assets from all contracts in a collection.

optional_parameters.name: token_ids
optional_parameters.description: An array of token IDs to search for (e.g. `?token_ids=1&token_ids=209`). Will return a list of assets with token_id matching any of the IDs in this array.

api_list.name: Single Collection
api_list.description: Used for retrieving more in-depth information about individual collections, including real time statistics like floor price.

required_parameters.name: collection_slug
required_parameters.description: The collection slug of this collection that is used to uniquely link to this collection on OpenSea

api_list.name: Bundles
api_list.description: Bundles are groups of items for sale on OpenSea. You can buy them all at once in one transaction, and you can create them without any transactions or gas, as long as you've already approved the assets inside.

optional_parameters.name: asset_contract_address
optional_parameters.description: Contract address of all the assets in a bundle. Only works for homogenous bundles, not mixed ones.

optional_parameters.name: on_sale
optional_parameters.description: If set to `true`, only show bundles currently on sale. If set to `false`, only show bundles that have been sold or cancelled.

optional_parameters.name: owner
optional_parameters.description: Account address of the owner of a bundle (and all assets within)

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: For pagination: how many results to return

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: For pagination: the index of the result to start at (beginning with 0)

optional_parameters.name: asset_contract_addresses
optional_parameters.description: An array of contract addresses to search for (e.g. `?asset_contract_addresses=0x1...&asset_contract_addresses=0x2...`). Will return a list of bundles with assets having contracts that match ALL of the addresses in this array. Useful for querying for mixed bundles, e.g. ones with CryptoKitties AND CK Talisman statues.

optional_parameters.name: token_ids
optional_parameters.description: A list of token IDs for showing only bundles with at least one of the token IDs in the list
